conclusion: Determine the coefficient of kinetic friction between the sheets of the books.
The books are divided into n equal parts.
When book B is pulled out, it experiences frictional forces from each part of book A.
Each part of book B has a weight of 5 N/n.
The normal force N on each part of book B due to the corresponding part of book A is 5 N/n.
The frictional force f between each pair of parts is f = μ(5 N/n).
The total frictional force F_f acting on book B is 5μ N.
From the table, when n = 4, the force F required to pull out book B is 46.5 N.
The force F must be equal to the total frictional force, so 46.5 N = 5μ N.
The value of the coefficient of kinetic friction μ is 9.3.
